thread.title: BREAKING: North Korea fires 'BALLISTIC MISSILE', South Korean media reports
thread.title_full: BREAKING: North Korea fires 'BALLISTIC MISSILE', South Korean media reports

title: BREAKING: North Korea fires 'BALLISTIC MISSILE', South Korean media reports
text:
BREAKING: North Korea fires 'BALLISTIC MISSILE', South Korean media reports BREAKING: North Korea fires 'BALLISTIC MISSILE', South Korean media reports NORTH Korea has launched an unidentified ballistic missile according to South Korean media, who cited military sources. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Sun, Feb 12, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:25, Sun, Feb 12, 2017 GETTY The North Korean army reportedly fired the missile Sunday morning. 
The weapon was fired in the direction of the East Sea, South Korea’s joint chiefs of staff have confirmed. 
Officials said the missile was launched around 10.55pm GMT (7.55am local time), from Banghyeon in the North Pyongan Province. Related articles Trump MUST prepare for North Korean attack, warns top US veteran 
The alarming act of military aggression comes little more than a week after Donald Trump’s defence secretary warned North Korea it would face an “effective and overwhelming response” if it chose to use nuclear weapons. 
General James ‘Mad Dog’ Mattis reassured South Korea the US would continue its support amid increasing fears over North Korea’s nuclear capabilities. 
He said: “Any attack on the United States, or our allies, will be defeated, and any use of nuclear weapons would be met with a response that would be effective and overwhelming. GETTY North Korea is believed to be increasing its weapons capabilities. GETTY US defence secretary James Mattis sent a stark warning to North Korean over its military aggression. Kim Jong-Un in pictures
